---
title: "Set X Axis"
---

*R/chart.R*

## chart_x_axis

## Description
 Set X Axis 


## Usage
```r
 
chart_x_axis( 
  ., 
  position = NULL, 
  position_on_y_axis = NULL, 
  scale_type = NULL, 
  min = NULL, 
  max = NULL, 
  flip = NULL, 
  scale_settings = NULL, 
  pretty_format = NULL, 
  show_zero = NULL, 
  title = NULL, 
  title_weight = NULL, 
  title_color = NULL, 
  title_size = NULL, 
  title_padding = NULL, 
  text_position = NULL, 
  text_size = NULL, 
  text_color = NULL, 
  text_angle = NULL, 
  text_weight = NULL, 
  text_max_lines = NULL, 
  text_line_height = NULL, 
  text_space_mode = NULL, 
  text_space = NULL, 
  tick_padding = NULL, 
  tick_mode = NULL, 
  tick_number = NULL, 
  tick_custom = NULL, 
  line_tick_color = NULL, 
  line_tick_width = NULL, 
  tick_length = NULL, 
  tick_side = NULL, 
  line_show = NULL, 
  edge_padding = NULL, 
  gridline_show = NULL, 
  gridline_color = NULL, 
  gridline_style = NULL, 
  gridline_width = NULL, 
  gridline_category_dividers = NULL, 
  gridline_category_dividers_extend = NULL 
) 
```

## Arguments
|Arguments|Description|
|---|---|
| . | The prior Flourish object. No need to specify name if piping graph as the graph will take the first argument (i.e. the prior existing graph). |
| position | X axis position ("bottom", "float-below" "float-above", "top", "off") |
| position_on_y_axis | X axis position on the Y axis (X intersects Y at zero...) |
| scale_type | Log, linear or date |
| min | X axis minimum value |
| max | X axis maximum value |
| flip | Flip X and Y axes |
| scale_settings | Configure minimum and maximum values |
| pretty_format | Pretty format X axis |
| show_zero | Show zero on the X axis |
| title | X axis title |
| title_weight | X axis title weight ("bold", "normal") |
| title_color | X axis title color |
| title_size | X axis title size (starts from 0, usually a number between 1 and 3 is a good choice) |
| title_padding | X axis passing |
| text_position | X axis text position ("default", "left", "right") |
| text_size | X axis text size (starts from 0, usually a number between 1 and 3 is a good choice) |
| text_color | X axis text color |
| text_angle | X axis text angle (0, 30, 45, 60, 90) |
| text_weight | X axis text weight ("bold", "normal") |
| text_max_lines | Maximum number of lines on X axis |
| text_line_height | X axis line height |
| text_space_mode | X axis space mode ("auto", "maxed", "fixed") |
| text_space | X axis space |
| tick_padding | X axis tick padding |
| tick_mode | X axis tick mode ("auto", "number", "custom") |
| tick_number | Approximate number of ticks or gridlines. The actual number will depend on the range of values, chart size, etc. |
| tick_custom | One tick label per line. Specify the ticks to show, one per line |
| line_tick_color | X axis line color |
| line_tick_width | X axis line width |
| tick_length | X axis tick length |
| tick_side | X axis tick side ("in", "out") |
| line_show | X axis visible |
| edge_padding | Edge padding (%). Space between start/end of axis line and first/last category tick as a percentage of the spacing between ticks. Max: 100 |
| gridline_show | Boolean (True/False) |
| gridline_color | Gridline color |
| gridline_style | Gridline style ("solid", "dash", "dot", "dot_dash") |
| gridline_width | Gridline width |
| gridline_category_dividers | Put lines between categories. On a categorical axis this option disables the gridline on each tick and instead adds rules between each category to give a table-like design. Ignored for date and numeric axes. |
| gridline_category_dividers_extend | Extend. Extends the dividers into the axis margins. |
